text:
In this [example](https://nilearn.github.io/auto_examples/03_connectivity/plot_adhd_spheres.html) on nil earn website, it says the coordinates of Default Mode Network are: [(0, -52, 18), (-46, -68, 32), (46, -68, 32), (0, 50, -5)]. 

I wonder where are these coordinates coming from? In what atlas/template? 

It seems that it's not the MNI coordinates according to [this paper](http://www.nature.com/ncomms/journal/v4/n1/fig_tab/ncomms2388_T1.html).
title: Coordinates of Default Mode Network
clean_text: In exampl nil earn websit say coordin default mode network 0 52 18 46 68 32 46 68 32 0 50 5 I wonder coordin come In atlastempl It seem mni coordin accord paper

text: i am not the developer, but the coordinates are within the DMN (e.g. [http://neurosynth.org/locations/0_-52_18_6/]).  the example uses adhd200 data from the fcon_1000 project - these should be in MNI space. hope that helps.
clean_text: develop coordin within dmn eg exampl use adhd200 data fcon1000 project mni space hope help

text: After looking back into nilearn history, "The coordinates of the spheres have been taken from a meta-analysis on neurosynth website".
clean_text: after look back nilearn histori the coordin sphere taken metaanalysi neurosynth websit

text: @cinvro Do you think this issue can be closed or you still waiting for more info about coordinates ?
clean_text: cinvro Do think issu close still wait info coordin

text:
